anchorRef: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Amidah, Patriarchs 1
anchorRefExpanded: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Amidah, Patriarchs 1
he: יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ פֹּ֘קֵ֤חַ עִוְרִ֗ים יְ֭הֹוָה זֹקֵ֣ף כְּפוּפִ֑ים יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה אֹהֵ֥ב צַדִּיקִֽים׃
text:
The LORD restores sight to the blind;
the LORD makes those who are bent stand straight;
the LORD loves the righteous;
versionTitle: Tanakh: The Holy Scriptures, published by JPS

anchorRef: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Amidah, Patriarchs 2
anchorRefExpanded: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Amidah, Patriarchs 2
he: אֲ֭דֹנָי שְׂפָתַ֣י תִּפְתָּ֑ח וּ֝פִ֗י יַגִּ֥יד תְּהִלָּתֶֽךָ׃
text:
O Lord, open my lips,
and let my mouth declare Your praise.
versionTitle: Tanakh: The Holy Scriptures, published by JPS

anchorRef: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Amidah, Patriarchs 3
anchorRefExpanded: Siddur Ashkenaz, Weekday, Shacharit, Amidah, Patriarchs 3
he: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ ע֨וֹד אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה כֹּֽה־תֹאמַר֮ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֹתֵיכֶ֗ם אֱלֹהֵ֨י אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִצְחָ֛ק וֵאלֹהֵ֥י יַעֲקֹ֖ב שְׁלָחַ֣נִי אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם זֶה־שְּׁמִ֣י לְעֹלָ֔ם וְזֶ֥ה זִכְרִ֖י לְדֹ֥ר דֹּֽר׃
text:
And God said further to Moses, “Thus shall you speak to the Israelites: יהוה,*יהוה This name (y-h-w-h; traditionally read Adonai “the Lord”) is here associated with the verb hayah “to be.” the God of your fathers’ [house]—the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob—has sent me to you:
This shall be My name forever,
This My appellation for all eternity.
versionTitle: The Contemporary Torah, Jewish Publication Society, 2006
